actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow an individual to elect a tax credit for 50 percent of his charitable contributions in lieu of the deduction allowed for such contributions.
short_title: Religious and Charitable Donors Tax Credit Act

summary.text: Religious and Charitable Donors' Tax Credit Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals a nonrefundable income tax credit for charitable contributions in lieu of a deduction. Provides that the credit shall not exceed 50 percent of the deduction which would be allowed or $500, whichever is less.

titles.title: Religious and Charitable Donors Tax Credit Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow an individual to elect a tax credit for 50 percent of his charitable contributions in lieu of the deduction allowed for such contributions.
